cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi ENE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west then west-southwest toward the south-central Texas coast and northern Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Corpus Christi, Texas (between Port Mansfield and Mesquite Bay)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect; all official watches are confined to the Texas coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Port Mansfield to Mesquite Bay TX; Tropical-Storm Warning: Barra el Mezquital MX to Port Mansfield TX and Mesquite Bay to High Island TX; Storm-Surge Warning: Port Mansfield to Sargent TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South and central Texas coastline and adjacent northeastern Mexico; upper Texas and Louisiana coasts will experience rain, rough surf, and rip currents
weather_observation.wind: Only slight chance (≤3%) of sustained 34-kt winds; occasional gusts possible in outer rain bands
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Baton Rouge; surge of 1–2 ft possible only along far southeast LA coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands from Hanna could drop 3–5 inches locally, with isolated totals above 4 inches over south-central Louisiana including Baton Rouge
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high surf along Louisiana beaches; minor river rises possible on the lower Mississippi due to heavy rain
